summary: The Agriculture Resilience Act of 2025 aims to address climate change impacts on agriculture, promoting sustainable practices and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. It establishes national goals for the agricultural sector, including emission reductions by 2030 and net-zero emissions by 2040. The bill focuses on research, soil health, farmland preservation, pasture-based livestock, on-farm renewable energy, and food loss/waste reduction. It includes provisions for crop insurance, conservation programs, and funding for various initiatives related to climate adaptation and mitigation within the agricultural sector. It addresses food date labeling and promotes the use of composting and anaerobic waste digestion.
